title: Janani Imathma crowned winner of ‘Derana Dream Star - Season 12’
byline: Janani Imathma was crowned the winner of “Derana Dream Star Season 12”, at the Grand Finale held at the Sugathadasa Indoor Stadium on Saturday night (17).

title: Politician Nandana Gunathilake passes away
byline: Politician Nandana Gunatilleke has passed away at the age of 64, while receiving treatment at the Ragama Hospital, according to family sources.

title: Trump tariff threat over Greenland ‘unacceptable’, European leaders say
byline: A threat by President Donald Trump to impose fresh tariffs on eight allies opposed to his proposed takeover of Greenland has drawn condemnation from European leaders.

title: Mainly dry weather expected over most parts of the island today
byline: Mainly dry weather will prevail in the most parts of the island, today (18), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Former Minister Nandana Gunathilake passes away
byline: Former Minister Nandana Gunathilake has passed away at the age of 64, while receiving treatment at the Ragama Hospital, according to family sources.

title: EU and Mercosur sign trade deal after 25 years of negotiations
byline: Top officials from the EU and the South American bloc Mercosur signed a free trade agreement on Saturday in Paraguay, paving the way for the European Union’s largest-ever trade accord after 25 years of negotiations.

title: Bus overturns in Haldummulla: Driver killed, three others injured
byline: A bus travelling from Colombo to Welimada has reportedly overturned in the Uvathenna area of Haldummulla.

title: Two suspects arrested with foreign-made revolver and ammunition in Maradana
byline: Two suspects have been arrested by the Colombo South Criminal Investigation Bureau with a foreign-manufactured revolver.

title: Nasa’s mega Moon rocket arrives at launch pad for Artemis II mission
byline: Nasa’s mega rocket has been moved to the launch pad in Cape Canaveral, Florida, as the final preparations get underway for the first crewed mission to the Moon in more than 50 years.

title: CEB employees seek Presidential intervention over delayed voluntary retirement process
byline: A group of employees who have applied for the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Voluntary Retirement Scheme (VRS) has written to the President, requesting intervention to safeguard the livelihoods of the 2,200 staff members who have applied for the VRS introduced under the CEB restructuring framework.

title: Political interests are not important to us; what matters is, only children – PM Harini
byline: The Prime Minister stated that the objective of the government is to use data and policy to provide what is best for children. Political interests or any other considerations are not important to us; what matters is, only the children, she said.

title: Road restoration underway in Kotmale following damage caused by Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The road restoration work has commenced under a special labour operation in the Kotmale Panangammana area and the Kotmale Maha Peella Ella, which were among the areas most severely affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Indians lead Sri Lanka tourists’ arrival in 2025
byline: Sri Lanka received a total of 2.3 million tourists in 2025, with Indian travellers accounting for the largest share, according to figures released by the tourism authority.

title: Zoe Saldaña dethrones Scarlett Johansson as highest-grossing actor of all time
byline: The recent blockbuster success of “Avatar: Fire And Ash” (2025) has given Zoe Saldaña a new career milestone as the highest-grossing actor of all time.

title: Indonesian authorities find wreckage of missing surveillance plane with 11 on board
byline: Indonesian authorities said on Sunday they had located the wreckage of a fisheries surveillance plane that went missing in South Sulawesi province near a fog-covered mountain, but were still searching for the 11 people on board.

title: Special police operation at Colombo-Katunayake Expressway and Kadawatha Interchange
byline: All vehicles exiting the Colombo-Katunayake Expressway and the Kadawatha Interchange have been inspected this morning (18), as part of a special operation aimed at preventing drug trafficking and other criminal activities.

title: World’s first legally binding treaty to protect oceans and marine life takes effect
byline: The world’s first legally binding agreement to protect marine life in international waters has taken effect, marking a historic moment for ocean conservation after nearly two decades of negotiations.

title: Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill challenged in Supreme Court
byline: Petitions have been filed before the Supreme Court seeking a determination that several clauses in the Parliamentary Pensions (Repeal) Bill are unconstitutional.

title: Political interests not important to us; what matters is, only children – PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya stated that the objective of the government is to use data and policy to provide what is best for children. Political interests or any other considerations are not important to us; what matters is, only the children, she said.

title: Court imposes heavy fines on three pharmacy owners for regulatory violations
byline: Court has imposed fines totaling Rs. 950,000 on owners of three private pharmacies for operating in violation of regulations issued by the National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA).

title: Youth shot dead in Alawwa
byline: A youth has been shot dead in Wilgamuwa, Alawwa, last night (17), police stated.

title: Over 800 arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids
byline: A total of 882 individuals have been arrested during island-wide raids conducted yesterday (17) under the “Nation United - National Drive” campaign aimed at eradicating narcotics from the country.

title: Train services to Palaviya to resume after 53 days
byline: Steps have been taken to resume train services from Colombo to Palaviya starting tomorrow (19), the Department of Railways has announced.

title: Defeated political forces attempting to reignite ethnic divisions – Dy Minister
byline: Defeated political movements are making attempts to once again instigate ethnic divisions within the country, Deputy Minister of Urban Development Eranga Gunasekara has stated.

title: Computer literacy rises to 38.4 pct in first half of 2025
byline: Sri Lanka’s computer literacy rate has risen to 38.4 percent in the first half of 2025, the latest survey by the Department of Census and Statistics show. more..

title: At least 5,000 killed in Iranian unrest, officials say
byline: At least 5,000 people have been killed in protests in Iran, including about 500 security personnel, an Iranian official in the region said on Sunday, citing verified figures and accusing “terrorists and armed rioters” of killing “innocent Iranians”.

title: Israel objects to US announcement of leaders who will help oversee next steps in Gaza
byline: Israel has objected to US President Donald Trump’s announcement of American leaders who will help oversee the next steps in Gaza.

title: Several sections of Northern Railway Line to be temporarily closed for renovation work
byline: The Northern Railway Line will be temporarily closed at several sections starting tomorrow (19) for renovation and maintenance work.

title: Strengthening primary healthcare key to controlling non-communicable diseases – Health Minister
byline: The primary challenge facing the country’s free healthcare sector is the rising prevalence of non-communicable diseases, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, the Minister of Health and Mass Media has stated.

title: Police issue guidelines amidst surge in financial scams
byline: The general public has been once again requested to exercise extreme caution when using social media platforms owing to a surge in financial scams online.

title: Man hacked to death following dispute over pigeons
byline: A man has been hacked to death following a dispute over pigeons in Meegahawatta, Peliyagoda this afternoon (18), police stated.

title: Man arrested at BIA while attempting to smuggle in 390 mobile phones valued at Rs. 34 mln
byline: An individual has been arrested at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) while attempting to smuggle 390 mobile phones into the country, Sri Lanka Customs stated.

title: Namal criticizes past governments’ approach to national development
byline: Every government which came to power in recent years focused solely on fulfilling its immediate responsibilities, without giving due consideration to positioning Sri Lanka on the global map, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa stated.

title: Over 1,800 kg of heroin seized in 2025 – Police Media Spokesman
byline: Sri Lanka Police have seized 1,821 kilograms and 174 grams of heroin during raids conducted in 2025, Police Media Spokesman Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler stated.

title: Frost covers several areas in Nuwara Eliya, range of vegetation affected
byline: Ground frost was observed in several areas in Nuwara Eliya in the past few days following a sharp drop in temperature.

title: European Space Agency hit by cyberattacks, hundreds of gigabytes of data stolen by hackers
byline: A major cybersecurity incident has taken place at the European Space Agency (ESA) after hackers targeted their systems and managed to steal scientific data.

title: Cabinet Minister vows to proceed with education reforms without interruption
byline: Education reforms will not be reversed under any circumstances, the Minister of Rural Development, Social Security and Community Empowerment, Upali Pannilage noted.

title: Government Radiologic Technologists threaten to strike on Wednesday
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists’ Association has decided to engage in an island-wide token strike based on several demands.

title: Iranian President warns that attacks on Khamenei mean “all-out war”
byline: Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian warned on Sunday that any attack on Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei would be considered a declaration of “all-out war” against the Iranian nation, following a sharp exchange of rhetoric with U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Final rites of ex-Minister Nandana Gunathilake to be held on Wednesday
byline: The final rites of former Minister, late Nandana Gunathilake will be performed on Wednesday (21) at 4.00 p.m. at the Wadduwa Public Playground.
